title: Use basic Bash/Terminal commands
description:
Learner is able to use Bash commands to:

  1. list all files in a directory including hidden files
  2. navigate up and down a directory structure
  3. redirect and pipe output between processes
  4. execute scripts from the terminal
  5. determine their network interfaces and IP address
  6. identify and edit environment and profile (e.g. .bash_profile) settings
  7. install software packages
  8. write and execute a custom script

title: Use CSS to style HTML elements
description:
Learner will be able to:

  1. Apply styles using inline, internal, and external style sheets
  2. Use the class, id, element, and universal selectors
  3. Use more complex CSS selectors including:
    1. attribute selectors
    2. pseudo-classes
    3. pseudo-elements
    4. combinators
    5. multiple selectors
  4. Include CSS written by others into their pages

title: Deploy a full stack web app
description:
The learner is able to:

  1. Choose proper file transfer options for deployment (e.g. Git, FTP, SCP, rsync)
  2. Compile app using build tools to deploy and test locally
  3. Deploy full stack app to hosted service (e.g. Heroku, AWS, Azure)
  4. Explain continuous integration and how it is used (e.g. TravisCI, Jenkins)
  5. Describe how an app can run on multiple servers at once
  6. Explain the purpose and value of load balancers and load testing

title: Implement routing and navigation
description:
The learner is able to:

  1. Choose between using a nested component or a route
  2. Configure routes using RouterModule
  3. Define URL segments for specific routes and also the default and wildcard routes
  4. Connect routes to actions using the RouterLink directive
  5. Use the RouterOutlet directive to display the routed component's view
  6. Pass parameters to a route using the ActivatedRoute service
  7. Navigate to routes programmatically using Router.navigate()

title: Use services to retrieve data
description:
Learner will be able to:

  1. Build Angular 2 services using the @Injectable decorator
  2. Register a service class provider in a component's metadata

title: Use Express scaffolding and view engines
description:
The learner is able to:

  1. Use a scaffolder (e.g. Yeoman) to layout an Express application
  2. Utilize an appropriate view engine (e.g. Pug) to serve static files

title: Use Date, Number, and Math objects
description:
Learner must be able to:

  1. create and format Dates and parse them from strings
  2. use the built-in Number object's properties and methods
  3. use the built-in Math object's properties and methods

title: Build a Full Stack Web Application
description:
The learner will be able to:

  1. Design the data structures and deploy a NoSQL data store such as MongoDB with complete CRUD functionality
  2. Build RESTful APIs and routes using NodeJs/Express that utilize the GET, POST, PUT, and DELETE verbs and serve as an interface to the NoSQL data store.
  3. Create a client-side user interface with Angular 2/TypeScript that utilizes:
    1. Modules
    2. Components
    3. Templates (HTML5 and CSS)
    4. Metadata
    5. Data binding
    6. Directives
    7. Services
    8. Dependency Injection
  4. Use a hosted site (e.g. GitHub) to store your source code and commit history.  Provide a complete, well-formatted ReadMe file that anyone can use to install and run your app.
  5. Leverage appropriate IDE and build tools to transpile, minify, and deploy code.
  6. Integrate at least one unit and one end-to-end automated test.

title: Define and use Functions
description:
Learner must be able to:

  1. create function definitions
  2. create function expressions including anonymous ones
  3. properly call functions
  4. demonstrate nested functions and closures
  5. create a recursive function
  6. use the arguments object
  7. demonstrate function parameters including default ones
  8. use Arrow functions

title: Perform CRUD operations on MongoDB
description:
Learner must be able to:

  1. Create collections and documents
  2. Use the insert commands to add documents to a collection
  3. Find and read documents in collections using the various find methods
  4. Add query filters to find documents which meet the query criteria
  5. Use update operations to update documents
  6. Remove documents from collections using the delete commands

title: Create functional Angular 2 components
description:
The learner is able to:

  1. Properly import required core Angular components 
  2. Implement the @Component decorator
  3. Properly define component properties using selector, moduleId, templateUrl, and styleUrls
  4. Properly define component methods that respond to events in the view
  5. Properly implement existing interfaces
  6. Define and use custom interfaces
  7. Export defined component for use in other modules

title: Create server-side automated tests
description:
Learner is able to:

  1. Install and run a server-side JS testing framework (e.g. Mocha)
  2. Install and write tests using an expectation library (e.g. Assert, Chai, Expect.js)
  3. Describe and use 'Behavior Driven Development' (BDD)

title: Configure and serve Express
description:
The learner is able to:

  1. Setup an Express server
  2. Start, stop, and restart the server
  3. Read the Request object and use its properties
  4. Use the Response object to reply including header and status codes
  5. Inspect the Request/Response objects using browser developer tools

title: Use events, callbacks, and promises
description:
Learner must be able to:

  1. discriminate between synchronous and async events and understand the complexity of async
  2. use callbacks to run after a function is completed
  3. use promises in place of callbacks

title: Control flow using conditional statements
description:
Learner must be able to:

  1. use blocks to group statements
  2. use if... else and switch statements
  3. throw exceptions using throw statement
  4. use try... catch block to respond and catch thrown exceptions

title: Utilize Express middleware
description:
The learner is able to:

  1. Effectively use common middleware such as body-parser
  2. Use middleware to do authentication/authorization and error handling (e.g. Passport)
  3. Implement a sessions API using cookies
  4. Implement a session store in the backend (e.g. MemoryStore, RedisStore, or MongoStore)

display_name: Install and use the Angular CLI to create and run a web application
title: Use Angular CLI to create and run app
description:
The learner will be able to:

  • Create a simple Angular web app using the CLI
  • Create a ReadMe.md file describing what the app does and how to install/run it
  • Commit and push this web app to an online repository

title: Perform basic Git operations
description:
Learner must be able to:

  1. describe the role and value of version control in software development
  2. configure Git user settings
  3. initialize a local Git repository
  4. clone a remote repository
  5. stage files, commit, revert and stash a commit
  6. display the git log
  7. push and pull from remote repo

title: Perform intermediate Git operations
description:
Learner must be able to:

  1. create feature branches and rebase/merge a trunk branch into feature branch
  2. create and merge pull requests
  3. create an appropriate .gitignore file
  4. diff files and resolve merge conflicts with a GUI tool but also through manual editing of the conflicted file
  5. execute soft and hard resets
  6. use a basic GitFlow process

title: Install and configure IDE or text editor
description:
Learner must be able to:

  1. install and configure an IDE (e.g. Webstorm) or text editor (e.g. VS Code)
  2. configure IDE to show syntax errors and JS linting errors
  3. configure and use autocompletion and other productivity enhancers
  4. configure IDE to execute local servers and other processes
  5. identify differences between IDEs and text editors
  6. configure and use debugging capabilities
  7. configure and use appropriate extensions

title: Use async/await for controlling parallelism
description: Learner will be able to:

title: Compose applications using modules
description:
Learner will be able to:

  1. Use ES 2015 modules in combination with Angular 2 modules
  2. Nest components within other components using @Input and @Output decorators
  3. Create Angular 2 modules using the NgModule decorator
  4. Import and export modules including feature and shared modules

title: Defining and Using Modules
description:
A learner must be able to:

  1. Import a module
  2. Import parts of a module
  3. Import all of a module
  4. Export defaults
  5. Export pieces other than defaults
  6. Understand the relationship of CommonJS and ES2016 modules

title: Define and use parameter functions to define a function
description:
A learner should be able to: 

  1. Identify the parameters of a function
  2. Define parameters of a function
  3. Use the parameters of a function in the function body

title: Create RESTful APIs using routes
description:
The learner is able to:

  1. Use the Express router to create modular, mountable route handlers
  2. Specify and use different routes based on pattern matching
  3. Define and use route parameters (named URL segments)
  4. Use route handlers (multiple callback functions that behave like middleware) to handle a request
  5. Explain what makes an API endpoint RESTful

title: Manipulate Strings and Regular expressions
description:
Learner must be able to:

  1. use the String object, it's length property, and its methods (e.g. indexOf, match, trim) to manipulate String data
  2. understand proper use of String literals
  3. write simple Regular expressions
  4. use the exec() method to search for a match in a string

title: Use the 'this' variable to access object properties
description:
A learner should be able to:

  1. Understand the 'this' variable and its importance in an object
  2. Assign properties to the 'this' variable
  3. Retrieve properties from the 'this' variable

title: Apply the Box Model for element layout
description:
Learner will be able to:

  1. Manipulate height, width, margin, border, and padding properties to achieve desired element layouts
  2. Use the display property (block, inline, inline-block) to effect element layout
  3. Utilize box shadows and the filter property to enhance UI elements

title: Use the predefined functions that javascript provides
description:
A learner should be able to:

  1. Use predefined functions:
    1. eval()
    2. isFinite()
    3. isNan()
    4. parseFloat()
    5. parseInt()
    6. decodeURI()
    7. encodeURI()
    8. encodeURIComponent()

title: Use OOP to build applications
description:
A learner should be able to:

  1. Understand the difference between a class and object literal
  2. Use a class to create multiple objects
  3. Understand 3 ways to create objects:
    1. Class
    2. Literal
    3. Object.create()
  4. Use inheritance to build relationships between objects

title: Defining Arrays
description: A learner should be able to:

title: Callback Functions
description: A learner should be able to:

title: Create and use Objects
description:
Learner must be able to:

  1. create new objects using object initializers and constructor functions
  2. define properties and methods of an object
  3. use "this" for object references
  4. define getters and setters for an object
  5. compare objects for equality
  6. explain concept of "object" within JavaScript
  7. explain differences between "class-based" and "prototype-based" languages

title: Use a constant and literal objects to construct objects
description:
A learner should be able to:

  1. Assign an object to a constant value
    1. Change the underlying object without breaking the constant
  2. Assign an object to an object literal value

title: Use the 'this' variable to access object properties
description:
A learner should be able to:

  1. Understand the 'this' variable and its importance in an object
  2. Assign properties to the 'this' variable
  3. Retrieve properties from the 'this' variable

title: Callbacks revisted
description: A learner should be able to:

title: Build a NodeJS web server
description:
The learner will be able to:

  1. Demonstrate a solid understanding of how HTTP works
  2. Compose an HTTP request and get a response from their server
  3. Create HTTP responses with headers and status codes
  4. Respond to HTTP requests with text, HTML, or JSON

title: Install and run Node JS
description:
The learner will be able to:

  1. Install and run Node JS and NPM
  2. Use the  REPL to evaluate JavaScript
  3. Install and uninstall local and global modules
  4. Use Node's built-in HTTP module to build a simple web server
  5. Create their own simple module and import it using Require
  6. Import only specific parts of a module
  7. Read and write files on the file system

title: Install, start and connect to MongoDB
description:
Learner must be able to:

  1. Install the MongoDB server
  2. Start and stop MongoDB using the mongod process
  3. Connect to MongoDB using NodeJS

title: Using data structures to organize data
description:
Learner must be able to:

  1. Understand the different types of data structures
    1. Create a stack and implement the appropriate methods
    2. Create a queue  and implement the appropriate methods
    3. Create a linked list  and implement the appropriate methods
    4. Create a double linked list  and implement the appropriate methods
    5. Create a tree  and implement the appropriate methods
  2. Understand when to use the different data types

title: Use properties to store object data
description:
A learner should be able to:

  1. Create a property using a the object literal syntax
  2. Access the property
    1. Using the dot notation
    2. Using the map notation
    3. Understand the difference and when to use each

title: Create client-side automated tests
description:
Learner will be able to:

  1. Explain the purpose and value of Test Driven Development
  2. Install and use a test framework to write basic tests (e.g. Jasmine)
  3. Setup and run unit tests using a test runner (e.g. Karma)
  4. Write and run end-to-end (e2e) user experience tests (e.g. Protractor)
  5. Identify and demonstrate unit, end-to-end, and regression/integration testing

title: Define and use parameter functions to define a function
description:
A learner should be able to: 

  1. Identify the parameters of a function
  2. Define parameters of a function
  3. Use the parameters of a function in the function body

description: A learner should be able to:

title: Utilize dependency injection
description:
Learner will be able to:

  1. Use injected service instances using constructor parameters
  2. Utilize a lifecyle hook method such as ngOnInit() to call injected service methods

title: Use OOP to build applications
description:
A learner should be able to:

  1. Understand the difference between a class and object literal
  2. Use a class to create multiple objects
  3. Understand 3 ways to create objects:

  4. Use inheritance to build relationships between objects

title: Use a try/catch block to control programatic flow
description:
A learner should be able to:

  1. Use a try/catch loop to handle errors
  2. Use a finally block to execute code
  3. Use a try/catch block to handle an error gracefully

title: Use REPL to evaluate expressions
description:
Learner must be able to:

  1. Start the REPL in a terminal
  2. Evaluate mathematical expressions in REPL
  3. Create a function and call the function
  4. Require (import) a third party library, load, and use that library

title: Use the constructor to pass data to super class
description:
A learner should be able to:

  1. Use the constructor to pass information to the super class
    1. Call the super class's constructor in the child's constructor
  2. Understand the relationship between super/child classes

title: Use data types, keywords, and primitives
description:
Learner must be able to:

  1. demonstrate proper use of JavaScript primitives
  2. explain and demonstrate type conversion
  3. explain and demonstrate writing statements using keywords and primitives
  4. explain literals to represent values in JavaScript
  5. explain difference between using primitives and using an Object that acts as a wrapper around the primitive data type (e.g. Boolean)

title: Use loops to iterate over Arrays and Objects
description:
Learner must be able to:

  1. explain and use for, for...in, and for...of statements to interate over an array or object
  2. use the while and do... while statements while a condition is true
  3. explain the labeled, break, and continue statements
  4. nest loops to traverse a multi-dimensional array

title: Use a try/catch block to control programatic flow
description:
A learner should be able to:

  1. Use a try/catch loop to handle errors
  2. Use a finally block to execute code
  3. Use a try/catch block to handle an error gracefully

title: Normal functions vs. Arrow functions vs. Shorthand functions
description: A learner should be able to:

title: Layout an HTML5 web page
description:
The learner is able to:

  1. Structure a valid document using html, head, title, body and script tags
  2. Properly use a broad mix of html5 elements and attributes
  3. Link to other pages and to named anchors within a web page
  4. Include images and comments in a page
  5. Create HTML5 tables to display tabular data
  6. Create a basic form and submit the form data
  7. Use advanced HTML5 elements such as Canvas and Video

title: Defining and calling methods on an object/class, and use getters/setters
description:
A learner should be able to:

  1. Define a function on a class
  2. Call a function on a class
  3. Define a getter function on a class
  4. Use a getter function on a class
  5. Define a setter function on a class
  6. Use a setter function on class
  7. Explain the benefits of using getters/setters/normal functions on a class

description:

  2. demonstrate hoisting and how code order effects flow
  3. demonstrate practical use of JavaScript closures

title: Employ advanced CSS techniques
description:
The learner will be able to:

  1. Use CSS animations properly and where appropriate
  2. Use transitions to good effect
  3. Create floated features such as drop caps, floated images, and multiple column layouts
  4. Tailor content to a range of output devices using media queries
  5. Use flexbox to overcome issues with float layout

title: Begin using JavaScript
description:
Learner must be able to:

  1. create and load a JavaScript file into an execution environment such as Node or a browser
  2. turn on strict mode and explain why it is better for scope reasons
  3. find their way around proper (e.g. MDN) documentation
  4. comment individual and block comments
  5. demonstrate how to output results using alert() and console.log() to assist with debugging
  6. declare and initialize variables
  7. demonstrate understanding of "operators" concept
  8. perform simple tasks using operators and assign the results to variables

title: Manipulate data in Arrays
description:
Learner must be able to:

  1. store various types of data in Arrays
  2. retrieve data from precise locations in an Array
  3. retrieve subsets of data from an Array
  4. combine, copy, add items and subtract from an Array

description:

  2. Debug with Firefox and Edge developer tools
  3. Create breakpoints and step into and over code blocks
  4. Create watch expressions and conditional breakpoints
  5. Identify logic errors in pieces of code by using the debugger

description:
A learner should be able to:

  2. Call the function express

title: Respond to NodeJS events
description:
The learner will be able to:

  1. Explain the event-driven architecture behind NodeJS
  2. Create events and use EventEmitter to emit them
  3. Handle emitted events including 'error' events

title: Explain key Angular 2 concepts
description:
The learner can:

  1. Describe how Angular 2 uses expressive HTML
  2. Explain the purpose and usage of Angular 2 data binding
  3. Relate how Angular 2 is modular by design
  4. Describe how Angular 2 integrates with back-end services
  5. Explain the overall architecture of an Angular 2 application

title: Defining and calling methods on an object/class, and use getters/setters
description:
A learner should be able to:

  1. Define a function on a class
  2. Call a function on a class
  3. Define a getter function on a class
  4. Use a getter function on a class
  5. Define a setter function on a class
  6. Use a setter function on class
  7. Explain the benefits of using getters/setters/normal functions on a class

title: Use the predefined functions that javascript provides
description:
A learner should be able to:

  1. Use predefined functions:
    1. eval()
    2. isFinite()
    3. isNan()
    4. parseFloat()
    5. parseInt()
    6. decodeURI()
    7. encodeURI()
    8. encodeURIComponent()

description: A learner should be able to:

title: Declare and use variables to store application specific logic
description:
A learner must be able to:

  1. Declare a variable
  2. Recall a previously stored variable
  3. Understand typing of a variable
  4. Understand a const

title: Troubleshoot advanced errors
description:
The learner is able to:

  1. Interpret complex console errors
  2. Examine and debug network requests
  3. Use online resources when encountering complex errors (e.g. Google, Stack Overflow)

title: Cryptography
description: A learner should be able to:

title: Use data binding and pipes
description:
The learner is able to:

  1. Use interpolation {{}} style property binding
  2. Use property binding [ ] style to link class with DOM
  3. Implement two-way data binding using ngModel
  4. Use default Angular pipes to filter data
  5. Create and use a custom pipe to filter data in a specific manner

title: Use REPL to evaluate expressions
description:
Learner must be able to:

  1. Start the REPL in a terminal
  2. Evaluate mathematical expressions in REPL
  3. Create a function and call the function
  4. Require (import) a third party library, load, and use that library

title: Declare and use a function expression
description:
A learner should be able to:

  1. Declare a function expression
  2. Call the function express
    1. Understand the 'this' of the expression
  3. Understand the difference between a function literal and a function expression
